questions.question: What is a chemical change?
questions.answer: A chemical change is a change in which the composition of a substance changes and a new substance with different properties is formed.

questions.question: What is a physical change?
questions.answer: A physical change is a change in which only the form or state changes but no new substance is formed.

questions.question: Give two examples of chemical changes.
questions.answer: Rusting of iron and burning of fuel are chemical changes because new substances are formed in both processes.

questions.question: Give two examples of physical changes.
questions.answer: Melting of ice and boiling of water are physical changes as no new substance is formed.

questions.question: What is meant by reactants?
questions.answer: Reactants are the original substances that take part in a chemical reaction and are written on the left side of the equation.

questions.question: What are products in a chemical reaction?
questions.answer: Products are new substances formed after a chemical reaction and are written on the right side of the equation.

questions.question: What does the arrow in a chemical equation indicate?
questions.answer: The arrow shows the direction of the reaction and separates reactants from products.

questions.question: What is a word equation?
questions.answer: A word equation represents a chemical reaction using names of substances instead of chemical formulae.

questions.question: What is a chemical equation?
questions.answer: A chemical equation represents a reaction using chemical symbols and formulae of reactants and products.

questions.question: What is respiration?
questions.answer: Respiration is a natural chemical change in which glucose reacts with oxygen to form carbon dioxide, water and energy.

questions.question: Why is respiration a chemical change?
questions.answer: Because new substances like carbon dioxide and water are formed from glucose and oxygen.

questions.question: What is photosynthesis?
questions.answer: Photosynthesis is a natural chemical process in which plants make glucose from carbon dioxide and water using sunlight.

questions.question: Name the gas released during photosynthesis.
questions.answer: Oxygen gas is released as a by-product during the process of photosynthesis.

questions.question: What is combustion?
questions.answer: Combustion is a fast chemical reaction in which a substance burns in oxygen to release heat and carbon dioxide.

questions.question: Why is combustion an irreversible change?
questions.answer: Because the original substance cannot be obtained back once it is completely burnt.

questions.question: What is hard water?
questions.answer: Hard water is water that contains dissolved salts of calcium and magnesium and does not lather easily with soap.

questions.question: How is hard water softened?
questions.answer: Hard water is softened by adding washing soda, which forms insoluble carbonates of calcium and magnesium.

questions.question: What is a precipitate?
questions.answer: A precipitate is an insoluble solid formed during a chemical reaction and settles at the bottom of the container.

questions.question: Why does lime water turn milky when CO2 is passed?
questions.answer: Because calcium carbonate precipitate is formed when carbon dioxide reacts with lime water.

questions.question: What is a chemical bond?
questions.answer: A chemical bond is the force that holds atoms together in a molecule or compound.

questions.question: Why do atoms form chemical bonds?
questions.answer: Atoms form bonds to complete their octet or duplet and achieve a stable electronic configuration.

questions.question: What are valence electrons?
questions.answer: Valence electrons are the electrons present in the outermost shell of an atom and take part in bonding.

questions.question: What is valency?
questions.answer: Valency is the combining capacity of an atom and equals the number of bonds it can form.

questions.question: What is an ionic bond?
questions.answer: An ionic bond is formed due to electrostatic attraction between oppositely charged ions.

questions.question: How is NaCl formed?
questions.answer: Sodium loses one electron and chlorine gains that electron, forming Na+ and Cl− ions which attract each other.

questions.question: What is an ionic compound?
questions.answer: An ionic compound is formed when positive and negative ions are held together by ionic bonds.

questions.question: What is a covalent bond?
questions.answer: A covalent bond is formed when atoms share valence electrons to complete their outer shells.

questions.question: How many electrons are shared in one covalent bond?
questions.answer: Two electrons are shared between two atoms to form one covalent bond.

questions.question: How is H2 molecule formed?
questions.answer: Two hydrogen atoms share one electron each to complete their duplet and form a covalent bond.

questions.question: Why is water a covalent compound?
questions.answer: Because oxygen shares electrons with two hydrogen atoms instead of transferring electrons.

questions.question: What is an ion?
questions.answer: An ion is a charged particle formed when an atom loses or gains electrons.

questions.question: What is a cation?
questions.answer: A cation is a positively charged ion formed by loss of electrons.

questions.question: What is an anion?
questions.answer: An anion is a negatively charged ion formed by gain of electrons.

questions.question: Why do noble gases not form bonds?
questions.answer: Because their outermost shell is complete, so they do not need to gain or lose electrons.

questions.question: What happens to sodium after losing one electron?
questions.answer: It becomes a Na+ ion and attains a stable octet in its outer shell.

questions.question: Why does chlorine gain an electron?
questions.answer: To complete its octet and achieve stable electronic configuration.

questions.question: What is neutralization reaction?
questions.answer: It is a reaction in which an acid reacts with a base to form salt and other products.

questions.question: Why is rusting called a slow chemical change?
questions.answer: Because it occurs gradually over a long period of time.

questions.question: Why is bursting of crackers a fast change?
questions.answer: Because the reaction occurs quickly and releases energy suddenly.

questions.question: What is meant by irreversible change?
questions.answer: A change that cannot be reversed to get back the original substance is called irreversible change.

questions.question: Why is dissolution of salt in water not a chemical change?
questions.answer: Because no new substance is formed and salt can be recovered by evaporation.

questions.question: Why does spoiled food smell bad?
questions.answer: Because chemical changes produce new substances with unpleasant smell.

questions.question: What change occurs in taste during chemical change?
questions.answer: Taste may change because new substances with different chemical properties are formed.

questions.question: Why are valence electrons important?
questions.answer: Because they participate in bond formation and determine chemical properties of elements.

questions.question: What type of bond is in HCl molecule?
questions.answer: HCl molecule has a covalent bond formed by sharing of electrons between hydrogen and chlorine.

questions.question: What is meant by electronic configuration?
questions.answer: It is the arrangement of electrons in different shells of an atom.

questions.question: Why is magnesium chloride ionic?
questions.answer: Because magnesium transfers electrons to chlorine forming Mg2+ and Cl− ions.

questions.question: Why does magnesium form Mg2+ ion?
questions.answer: Because it loses two electrons to complete its octet in the next lower shell.

questions.question: What is meant by duplet?
questions.answer: Duplet means two electrons in the outer shell, which gives stability to hydrogen and helium.

questions.question: Why do atoms try to complete octet?
questions.answer: Because a complete octet gives chemical stability similar to noble gases.

questions.question: What is meant by man-made chemical change?
questions.answer: It is a chemical change brought about intentionally by humans for useful purposes.

questions.question: Give an example of man-made chemical change.
questions.answer: Burning of fuel for cooking and cleaning tiles with acid are man-made chemical changes.

questions.question: Why is cleaning of Shahabad tiles a chemical change?
questions.answer: Because calcium carbonate reacts with acid to form new substances like calcium chloride and CO2.

questions.question: Why are ionic bonds strong?
questions.answer: Because strong electrostatic forces exist between oppositely charged ions.

questions.question: Why are covalent compounds usually weak?
questions.answer: Because shared electrons create weaker intermolecular forces compared to ionic attraction.

questions.question: What indicates gas formation in reaction?
questions.answer: Bubbles and hissing sound indicate that gas is being released during a chemical reaction.

questions.question: What happens when baking soda reacts with lemon juice?
questions.answer: Carbon dioxide gas is released and new substances are formed, showing chemical change.

questions.question: Why does taste change during chemical change?
questions.answer: Because chemical composition changes and new substances have different taste.

questions.question: Why does color change indicate chemical change?
questions.answer: Because formation of new substances often produces different colored compounds.

questions.question: What is meant by breaking of bonds?
questions.answer: Breaking of bonds means separation of atoms in reactants during chemical reaction.

questions.question: What is meant by formation of bonds?
questions.answer: Formation of bonds means atoms join together to form new molecules or compounds.

questions.question: Why are chemical equations useful?
questions.answer: They help to understand substances involved and products formed in reactions clearly.

questions.question: Why are balanced equations important?
questions.answer: Because they obey law of conservation of mass and show equal atoms on both sides.

questions.question: What is meant by conservation of mass?
questions.answer: Mass of reactants is equal to mass of products during a chemical reaction.

questions.question: Why does magnesium need two chlorine atoms?
questions.answer: Because magnesium loses two electrons and each chlorine gains one electron.

questions.question: What is the role of sunlight in photosynthesis?
questions.answer: Sunlight provides energy needed to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose.

questions.question: Why does carbon burn in oxygen?
questions.answer: Because oxygen supports combustion and reacts with carbon to form carbon dioxide.

questions.question: What is meant by slow chemical reaction?
questions.answer: A reaction that takes place over a long time is called slow chemical reaction.

questions.question: What is meant by fast chemical reaction?
questions.answer: A reaction that occurs very quickly with rapid energy release is called fast reaction.

questions.question: Why is respiration continuous?
questions.answer: Because living cells constantly need energy which is released during respiration.

questions.question: Why are chemical changes important in daily life?
questions.answer: Because many useful processes like cooking, digestion and respiration depend on them.

questions.question: Why is digestion a chemical change?
questions.answer: Because complex food substances are converted into simpler substances.

questions.question: Why is melting of ice reversible?
questions.answer: Because water can be frozen again to form ice.

questions.question: Why is burning of paper irreversible?
questions.answer: Because original paper cannot be obtained from ash.

questions.question: What is meant by chemical composition?
questions.answer: It refers to the types and numbers of atoms present in a substance.

questions.question: Why is formation of gas sign of chemical change?
questions.answer: Because new gaseous substance is produced during reaction.

questions.question: Why is sound produced during some reactions?
questions.answer: Because rapid gas formation or explosion releases sound energy.

questions.question: Why does balloon burst show physical change?
questions.answer: Because no new substance is formed, only shape and size change.

questions.question: Why does cut potato turn dark?
questions.answer: Because oxygen reacts with substances in potato causing chemical change.

questions.question: Why is ripening of fruit a chemical change?
questions.answer: Because new substances are formed that change color, taste and smell.

questions.question: What is meant by stability of atom?
questions.answer: Stability means atom has complete outer shell and does not react easily.

questions.question: Why does hydrogen form covalent bonds?
questions.answer: Because it cannot lose or gain electrons easily and shares electrons instead.

questions.question: Why does sodium not form covalent bonds easily?
questions.answer: Because it easily loses its valence electron to form ionic bond.

questions.question: What is meant by electrostatic force?
questions.answer: It is force of attraction between opposite charges like positive and negative ions.

questions.question: Why do ions attract each other?
questions.answer: Because opposite charges attract due to electrostatic force.

questions.question: Why are covalent bonds directional?
questions.answer: Because shared electrons are located between specific atoms.

questions.question: What is meant by molecule?
questions.answer: A molecule is the smallest particle of a substance that can exist independently.

questions.question: What is meant by compound?
questions.answer: A compound is formed when two or more different elements combine chemically.

questions.question: Why are ionic compounds hard?
questions.answer: Because strong forces exist between oppositely charged ions in lattice structure.

questions.question: Why do ionic compounds dissolve in water?
questions.answer: Because water separates ions and stabilizes them in solution.

questions.question: Why do covalent compounds not conduct electricity?
questions.answer: Because they do not form free ions in solution.

questions.question: What is meant by lattice structure?
questions.answer: It is regular repeating arrangement of ions in ionic crystals.

questions.question: Why is sodium very reactive?
questions.answer: Because it easily loses one valence electron to become stable.

questions.question: Why is chlorine very reactive?
questions.answer: Because it easily gains one electron to complete its octet.

questions.question: Why do atoms share electrons?
questions.answer: To complete their outer shell and achieve stable configuration.

questions.question: What is meant by bond energy?
questions.answer: It is energy required to break a chemical bond between atoms.

questions.question: Why are chemical bonds important?
questions.answer: They allow atoms to combine and form molecules and compounds.

questions.question: Why is chemical change permanent?
questions.answer: Because new substances formed cannot be converted back easily.

questions.question: What is meant by chemical property?
questions.answer: It is a property that describes how a substance reacts chemically.

questions.question: Why is study of chemical bonds important?
questions.answer: Because it explains how substances are formed and why they have specific properties.
